text: Almost clear light amber with lasting off white head. Fantasticly complex and balanced aroma of cornflakes, bread, citrus and vinegar etc. Not overly acidic. The taste is low in sweetness and bitterness and has a distinct but balanced acidity. Finish and aftertaste follows the same flavors and is balanced all the way through. Great beer.

2015 bottle shared by Johnnnie on 5/20/17.Clear, well-carbonated, bronze-golden with strong copper tints and a white head atop that fades slowly to a ring.Id be curious to know what the proportions of each blenderys lambic are used in this. From the nose I get a LOT of leather, cider, light green apple, sweat, mineral and hay-like grains. These things I associate most strongly with Boon, Oud Beersel and to some extent, Lindemans). It doesnt have the vivacious, bright Brett character of 3F, though of course, there is certainly light Brett in the nose. And nor does it have the stronger lactic acidity I associate with De Cam, Timmermans and Hanssens. Whatever the case, its very approachable with a surprisingly large amount of malt character (rich honey, hay, wheat-like cereal) to easily balance the tart, lemony Brett and light lactic sourness. A bit of farm-y character, though its more cider and mineral-dominated. No alcohol or flaw.Bright and lemony with light cider on the edges and a good lactic sourness that fails to completely pucker the mouth or strip the enamel. Its well-balanced showing the aforementioned honey-like malt with even a touch of biscuity wheat. Lots of musty, cellar quality as it warms and breathes. Doesnt display the sheer force of intense lambic flavor that 3F and Cantillon do, for me, as theres a lot of, while pleasant, extraneous flavors at work. Slightly bigger body than Id like, could use just a bit more dryness. Otherwise, very lovely and Im sure much more approachable than most lambics.

750ml bottle 2017, thanks Tanno. Pours almost clear golden, small white head. Vinegar, green apple, white wine in aroma. Taste is tart, raw gooseberry, mild barrel, green apple and vegetables... Medium bodied, below average carbo. Wateriness in aftertaste, some vinegar. Meh, expected more, but still enjoyable.

Megablend 2017. Pours yellow with light white head. Aroma is sour, some shit, mould, bitter notes, fruits. Taste is acid, vinegar, some marinated vegetables, light bitterness, strong aftertaste, clear citric acid notes. Super beer!
Bottle 0,75. Thanks to Slacker. Pours hazy orange with small white head. Lots of fruits, some citrus, mild sourness, very nice. Light body and average to high carbonation.

Aroma: Fruits, sour, farmyard.
Appearance: Pale color, haze with small white head.
Taste: Fruits, sour, a little pleasant sour.
Palate: Light body, high carbonation, smooth.

From Toer de Geuze 2017 -- Vielle Gueuze apparemment assemblée chez Boon >> Nez très parfumé: brett, acidulé et boisé, caramel sans amertume. Je reçois beaucoup de rondeur caramélisée à lattaque, et qui perdure sur toute la dégustation; ce qui donne à cette bière tout son cachet. Assez bien maltée, cest un sucre dorge acidulé mais sans sucrosité, avec des arrières goûts de barriques plus ou plus complexes: soit vineux, soit fruités; lacidité restant supportable et agréable comparée à dautres Vielles Gueuzes.
Bottle - Vintage 2107 - Green grape and lime with light funk. Clear gold with a decent white head. Tart, light funk and green grape. Clean and easy finish. Very balanced and drinkable, not much funk.

2015 Edition. From 32GP. In Teku glass. Playing 12 Labours of Hercules. Although Im not a fan of vinegars, this one is very balanced and approachable. Smooth, with noticeable yet not agressive funk notes. Very lasting foam and excellent in nose

Bottle, 750 ml at Craft Room, shared with Marko, veceo, Trolleo. Pours hazy golden, small white head. Lots of horse blanket, sour, over carbonated, citrus, wood. Less carbonation would be good, otherwise very nice.

750ml 2015, bottled 2014-10-31, best before 2034-10-31. Pour pale orange a bit hazy with nervous bubbles and a white foam. Aroma if from the funky acidity, wood, citrus and light malt. Taste if from green apple, dusty, brett (Barn) and fruity. Medium body and high carbonation. Dry and smooth. Long tart and fruity finish.
Very good, but not necesarilly better than the sum of its parts. Naturally very complex, funky and some bretty sourness going on.

750ml bottle. (2009 vintage) Pours an unclear amber-orange with lots of sediment and a large, frothy, short lived, off-white head that laces. Sour aroma of lemon, orange, apricot, brett, horse blanket and oak. Sweet fruity flavour of orange, grapefruit, lemon, apricot, leather, brett, vinegar and oak with a crisp, sour, acidic, bone dry, champagne like finish. Medium body with an oily texture and lively carbonation. Lots of complexity, an excellent gueuze. This beer aged nicely.
Bottle at tasting, 2015 edition. Golden pour. Aroma of horseblanket, tart, oak and old hops. Taste has nice funky horseblanket, oak, soft fruit and old hops. Great gueuze.
[2013] 750ml bottle. Hazy amber with a foamy white head. Flavors are oak, stone fruits, grass and lemon with earthy and funky notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, slick texture.
75cl bottle. Slow gusher. Hazy orange pour with a tall white head. Notes of barnyard funk, sour funk, bitter yeast and dank cellar, a bit of citrus. Decent.

75cl bottle shared with friends (2015 edition). Pale golden with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with quite some carbonation. Well balanced sour and sweet tones. Tart, oak, white grapes, citrus, some apple and spices. Nice!

2015 Bottle. Lightly hazy golden orange with a lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is of white grapes, apple, grassy, funky, light citrus. Taste is of white grapes, green apple, fresh peppers, grassy, citrus, funky, light acidity. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

2015 version bottle @ home. Clear golden colour. Smells slightly burning car tyre, dusty, sourish, fruity. Tastes sour, fruity, apple. Not too crazy when it comes to sourness. Nice.

From notes. Enjoyed at the Drie Fonteinen Restaurant on November 12. 750 mL bottle, 2015 vintage. The pour is a dark orangey gold color with a thick white head and no lace as it falls down to a thin cap. The aroma carries a lightly metallic malt to it, but its pretty good. There is a bright citrus zest and a funky yeast going on. There is a bit of barnyard on the back end, and its actually pretty nice. There is a bit of oak as well as it wraps up. The flavor is similar. The metallic fades, but a mineral tendency introduces itself. The oak is there and strong and the citric acid gets a little lighter. The mouth feel is nice. Its a little heavy, but well carbonated and leaves a nice tart and funky barnyard mix of fruit skins on the finish. This is pretty lovely.
bottle with thanks to kappldav123! Hazy pale straw-golden with a fluffy white head. Barnyardy start with tart character, shy bitter hoppy notes in the finish.

Aroma: leather, barnyard, green bell pepper, hay
Taste: medium sour, barnyard, tart apple, leather, fruity

W aromacie najbardziej brettowe, dominuje siano i nutki zielone, brakuje nut słodszych. W smaky tez najwyższa kwaśność, odczucie siana i stosunkowo wysoka pestkowa goryczka. Piwo charakterne, ale na pewno nie tak szlachetne jak poprzednicy.

Aromat jest zdziczały i skisły. W zapachu mamy dużo konia, siana spod konia i spoconego zadu konia. Jest "końsko i zagrodowo", a przy tym przyjemnie. 
W smaku piwo jest wyraźnie kwaśne, po raz pierwszy tego wieczoru wystąpiło u mnie charakterystyczne "ściąganie" ślinianek. Ponownie kompozycję smakową budują nuty dzikie i cytrusy, tutaj o nieco mineralnym charakterze. Finisz wytrawny, cierpki.
Une magnifique gueuze tout en tension à la robe ambrée et au nez typé, mais surtout à la bouche à la fois tendue et ample, dune longueur impressionnante. Un régal absolu

Bottle, 2013 version (shared by harri, thanks!). Pours golden. Aroma is sour, very funky, fruity, apricots. Flavor is sour and somewhat bitter, funky, fruity, citrus, apricots, and wood. Finish has some bitterness. Excellent balance. Overall: great brew, a lot better than I expected.

2015 version. Pours a hazy golden orange from the bomber with fluffy white head  that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma of big funky notes over a hint of acidity and sweet fruitiness. Taste is even more of the funk, horsey like crazy, then falls to notes of lemon and tart acidity. Bubbly effervescence, soft and easy, really nice.

Bottled 750ml. -at the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Yellow/golden coloured, small white head, dusty sour nose. Really pleasant sour taste with notes of fruits, wood and spices. Lingering tart finish. Very very nice. 2015 vintage.
Sample at SBWF 2016. Tart taste and smell with citrus and grapefruit. Very refreshing. Strong tartness.
Sample from bottle at Stadin Panimo, Helsinki. 2015 Vintage. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tropical fruits, sweetness and some sourness. Sweet and juicy.

2015 version at the MBR Sour / Wild Beer gathering. Enormous thanks to whoever bought it! And Ludo for importing it! Misty yellow golden. Light funky aroma, nicely citric. Light funky soft taste, slightly citric, and the citric notes are quite wonderful! Solid tartness. This is very good stuff!
2011 Version Pours a blonde colour. Taste is sour, spicy with some cork and champagne. Very Good
2011 Edition. Golden appearance. Quite a prefumed aroma. Flavour has some dry cork and tropical fruit. Nicely balanced, sweet/sour.

75cl bottle paired with dim sum. Pours a misty orange, fresh funk aroma. Taste is wonderfully crisp, complex and super refreshing with a buzzsaw sourness. Perhaps not as sharp as expected but the prickly grapefruit and lemon zest in the background make up for that. A very enjoyable one this.

At a friends, beer tasting evening. 2015 edition, 75cl bottle. The review is written from memory, so not very detailed...

Pour: dark orange, golden amber. Medium-low carbonation, good foam.
Nose: Citrus, funk, flowers.
Taste: Awesome sourness, lemon, tart, fruits, funk.
Verdict: Probably the best gueuze I have tasted yet! Really nice and balanced, with a dominant and clean sourness. The flavour was perfect for me!

Taste is tart, grainy, fruity, citrus rind, lemon, grapefruit, white wine, woody, barnyard. Medium bodied, sour citric light bitter finish. Quite drinkable.

Old rating rerated 04.08 2016, 0,75l bottle (2011 vintage, bottle #05955) shared @ BBGTC tasting:
Big fizzy-creamy longlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is dry sour-ish, oak, minerals, sorrel, bark, brett, old rope, mild vinegar, berry skin, weeds. Taste is mild sour-ish, weeds, sorrel, unripe berries, oak, minerals, old rope, mild vinegar, lemon juice. Medium bitterness, sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a cloudy orange body with a small white head. Nose is intense horseblanket notes, stable funk, hay, heavy lactic notes and hints of red berries, apple vinegar and floral tones. Taste is sharp bretty notes, stable funk, barnyard notes, hay and hints of red berries, apple vinegar, white pepper and wood. Light body, medium to high carbonation. Lovely stuff, complex, funky, spicy and intriguing. Well suited to represent some of the finest lambic brewers on the planet.

0.75l corked bottle, No 05955 shared with The Tasting Crew. This one pours a cloudy darker orangey colored body with a medium sized quickly fading white top. Smells nice. Both sweet and dusty. Old cheese, generic fruits and a nice smooth sourness. Mild wet lemons and ham. Really complex and not bad at all. It has a good dandelion bitterness, lots of woody yeast. A really thick and almost syrupy mouthfeel on this and its soft and near prickling on the bubbles. Woody and mild sour. More bitter than sour. A little tomato essens and tartness, melony fruits, a little white sugar lightness and its somewhat lightdrinkable despite the relatively high abv. Tasty and somewhat refreshing. 04.08.2016

Sampled at Mechazillas epic insanity tasting session. Quite an epic blend, can feel lemon, apple, berries, nice balance, smooth mouthfeel, dry finish. Nice one, very smooth and enjoyable blend, maybe I expected it a tad richer though.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 750 ml bottle. 2015. Orange colour. Nice white medium head. Peachy, grassy notes. Hints of vinegar. Slight barnyard. Wood. Rich aroma. Peachy notes. Grassy, citrussy notes. Wood. Hints of orangecore. Really well balanced, refreshing, enjoyable gueuze. Really good beer. 

750ml bottle. 2017. Pours dark yellow, almost orange colour. Medium white head which disappears quite quickly. Lots of earthy notes, barnyard, spicy, very slight herbal notes, oak, slight acidity, slight notes of citrusses in the aroma. Lots of barnyard, earthy notes, spicy notes, acidity, citrussy notes, funk in the taste. Earthy aftertaste. Has already now more body than the usual gueuze has. Has huge cellaring potential. Still convinced that all editions should be rated separately. Every previous edition is a different beer. So, as I know what kind of beer it will be after a year or a year an a half I do not change my rating.

7.5cl sample at the Ghent Beer Festival VI (22 VIII 2015). The unbelievable megablend between young and old Lambic from 3 Fonteinen, Boon, De Oude Cam, De Troch, Hanssens, Lindemans, Oud Beersel, Tilquin and Timmermans. I have the 2015 bottle in my cellar - for aging (five years or so) - and this sample is a fresh one of the 2015 batch. First of all, this fresh drink not really is outspoken, alas. Highly carbonated, lots of (lemon) grass, some citrus and fruits. Maybe some zest in the mouthfeel too. The general character is sour and tart with a fruity balance. Some hay, some funk. Dry finish, as expected.

Bottle shared at Mechazilla event. 2015 vintage. Wonderfully tart nose with lemon, gooseberry and granny smith apples dominating the nose. Some white grape notes come out as it warms as well as barnyard notes. Highly carbonated with a lovely creamy, oaky feel on the palate. Very sherry-like. The finish is dry and crisp with more of that oak feel that lingers. Fantastic.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Szybko opadajaca piana, zloto metne. W aromacie mocno dzikie, stajenno estrowe, intensywne. W smaku kwaskowe, cytrynowe, delikatne. Absolutnie nie czuc 7% abv. Srednio nagazowane.
Bottle from belgoklubben vintage 2015. Beer tasting @ jörns place. Pours a golden colour beer with a large head. Sour, bretty with green apples. Well balanced. Dry finish

Vintage 2011
Świetna konska derka, stajnia, intensywne nuty owocowe, cytrusowe, goryczkowe. W smak świetna dzikosc, zbalansowana cierpkosc i kwas, owocowosc, nuty skórzane. Swietne piwo, cudownie ułożone i degustacyjne

Bottle at De Heeren Van Liedekercke, march 12th 2015. Unclear yeallow body with white lacings. Funky aroma with leather, grass, lemon peel. Taste is sour, barnyard, green apples, soft bitterness. Fresh finish with a lasting horseblanket and moist cellar aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 2011 Vintage. Hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma of barnyard, citrus, funk, orange zest, leather, very intense and nice. Taste is medium sour, very dry but nicely balanced. Flavor of lemon, grapes skin, sour gooseberries, red currant, leather, and earthy note. Very nice mouthfeel, beer is quite bodied, oily and smooth texture. Great Vintage. 
2013 and 2015 are also very tasty.

Megablend 2015, always nice to find a geuze in my travels. Has ever so modest head and a great foggy peach body with just a hint of carbonation. Aroma of must, hay, lemon-soaked shoe leather, rotting orange juice - in other words, an awesome geuze smell. Taste is absolutely perfect for a geuze - lots of citrus balanced out by earthy notes, and the mouthfeel is perfection. Lite and dry on the mouth, crisp carbonation dancing - yeah, I said it, dancing! All frilly and that I tells ya, this is really good stuff. One of those rare beers worth travelling the world to find.
Bottle @ 3 Små rum. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Sour and fruity tones. Sour, fruit, stable and acidic. Medium body with a long dry / acidic finish.

75cl bottle from etre gourmet, I think. Hazy gold color. Thin to medium white head. Medium sourness, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Taste is balanced but somewheat leans towards sweetness. Aroma is citric, herby, hops.

Bottke. Thx Halling. Pours copper with a white head. Aroma of funk, horseblank, gooseberries, mineraler, sesem, good funk, fruity. Taste is rather sour, funky, barnyard. Quite carbonated with a sweet touch.
Bottle 75cl. Stable white layer, hazy peach color. Aroma is hay, apple, citrus, nettles, sour mix. Sour taste. Few surprises, but none mistakes.

Bottle at RBWG 2016. Thanks Theydon. Nose is very barny and funky. A touch of lemon. Very hazy deep yellow to orange. Taste is moderately zesty with a touch of wood and zest. Lightly acidic. Pretty nice.
Bottle, 2015. Hazy golden-orange colour with white head. Fruit, apple, funky, dust aroma. Sweet, fruit, apple, sour taste. Medium body.
Bottled, shared by Caesar. Orange golden colored. Fruity nose, citrus and apple, brett. Sour, but not very extreme, quute dry, fruity. Nice, but not overly impressive.

2015 Vintage:

AROMA: Musty, dank, mellow tropical fruits, maybe even medicinal but on a very low level.

APPEARANCE:Blonde going on for golden, huge white head nearly escaped the glass though it quickly diminished into a lasting wispy one. 

TASTE: Not as Intense as one might imagine, quite a spritzy bugger. Sourish, although those who dont drink Gueuze regularly may take that as a pinch of salt. Just overall not the most intense Gueuze but still very good. 

PALATE: Long lasting dank aftertaste with an low level of of tropical fruit and over ripe green apples. 

OVERALL: Please take this in context. A good Gueuze however not the best from the country. Still am excellent example though and I have 4 bottles of it cellaring which is testament to its quality. Really, really good but not one of the best.
hay, dough, earthy, woody, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, good but want more complexity.

Bottle. Big funky aroma of cotton, lemon juice, lime, light strawberry and light barnyard. Tastes super funky. Big strawberry and lime. Light sweetness that comes off a bit artificial. Light sourness. Very dry finish. Solid but not amazing.

Flaska från Etre Gourmet. 2011 vintage. Disig orange vätska, lätt kolsyrad. Frisk och syrlig doft med en hel del stallkaraktär, syrliga äpple, fat. Kraftig, stor kropp, lätt sötma men också väldigt torr. Har allt man vill ha i en bra gueuze. Rejäl men mjuk syra, funk, stall, syrliga äpplen, fat, torr eftersmak med lätt beska. Fantastisk gott.

Hazy vibrant orange, lightly sparkling, compact foamy white head. Aroma is sherbet, plastic, dirty russet apples, coriander, toasted bread. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is semi-sweet, vanilla, lemon zest, dried apricots, more sherbet,  lightly sour, fruity white wine. Excellent.  (4.4)
Apr 2016 - Another 750ml bottle, and there will be many more.  At a meet-up with old friends, but I smashed this back myself.  This stuff is at its best when youre savouring the last 200ml.  Punchy crisp sour fruit.  It has to be one of if not the best of the (relatively) easy to get lambics.  (4.2)

Malts, sweet, fruit, wheat, slightly sour, wood. Really complex and hard to put in words.

Appearance:

Turbid golden/amber beer with a slight white head.

A lightly hazed golden Gueuze with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet mineral malt with light lactic notes, Epsom salts, light Brett, light horse blanket, very nice. In mouth, a nice mineral sweet malt with light lactic notes, light Epsom salts, light horse blanket, complex and beautiful. 2013 bottle at Montréal Xmas gathering 2015.

Botella 75 cl tomada en el momento en Cimmeria. 25..11..2015. (459). Lote 43041 hasta 31..10..2034. Color amarillento tostado con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores cereales suaves y maderas con toques a cavas y vinos espumosos. Gran combinación donde nada resalta demadiado y todo está fino y equilibrado. Gran cerveza en su estilo. Bastante buena. Para repetir sin duda.

2015 vintage. 750mL corked & caged Champagne bottle from Beer Cartel. BB 31/10/2034!!
Effervescent hazy orange-gold body, dense white head persists.
Doesnt give away much at first, but opens up with warmth (and air) - hay, apricot & peach, grapefruit, white grape, touch of old oak, lees, faint hard cheese & horse.
Lots of structure on the palate - lengthy acidity, some tannin, lively creamy carbonation.
Juicy body, full of character - unripe peach & apricot & grapefruit once again, grainy malts, light herbal/floral quality, subtle oak, cheesy finish with a touch of acetic & citric acid lingering.
Refined & complex; lovely.

Bottle shared at home. Clear orange golden with fizzy white head that leaves a nice ring of little bubbles. Lots of funk up front, hay, apple juice, champagne, light burnt rubber, grains and some dough. Nice grassy and soft flowery notes in the finish. Under medium sweet and sour with a light rubbery bitter finish. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Very nice.
750ml bottle pours out a hazy golden topped with a white head. Nose is great super buggy barnyard horse blanket notes. Taste is more of the super buggybbarnyard funk. This is great.

2011 vintage. Pours a very hazy, bright golden orange color with tangerine hues and a frothy, two finger, pillowy white head. Good retention, only slowly setting into a thick, lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Musty aroma with lots of earthy barnyard character along with lactic funk, damp oak, hay, light fruit and acidic acid. Subtle acetic character but its not solvent-like or overly vinegary. Oak tannins along with musty bugs, horseblanket, lactic funk, grass and straw. Some light fruit in there as well, notably apple and pear complimenting the lemon acidity. The nose on this beer is pretty complex with plenty of earthy funk. 

Full bodied with soft carbonation and tart, puckering sourness that lingers over the barnyard/ lactic funk flavors, oaky tannins, light fruit and citrus acidity into a tart, dry finish. Very nice sour element by not harsh or overly acetic. Crisp citrus/lemon juice acidity countered by earthy oak and lactic cheesiness. Sweaty with dry, funky bugs, lemon spritz and a lingering soft acetic flavor that makes me drool for more. Very refreshing and easy to drink considering the complexity and level of sourness.
smells of vinegar, cloudy amber gold colour, tastes of sour apricot goodness!

Bottle brought home from Weekend Of Spontaneous Fermentation. Shared with Rachel & Nick. Pours hazy Golden Amber with a short, White head. Aroma of funky Brett and vinegar. Taste has loads of that good, good funk and some citric tartness. Unusually potent for a Geueze. I loved it.

Courtesy of Darshan
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate cork, citrus, lemon, oak, and funk. Its a hazy dull orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate tart citrus with a touch of sweet tarts. The finish has light-moderate lemon, cork, and oak. It?s light bodied with light-moderate carbonation.

19.12.2014 - Had Megablend 2011.

Rating #1234 - 21.08.2014 - Bottle from CBI - Megablend 2013 (9th Tour de Gueuze) Pours hazy golden with a bubbly white head. Aroma of orange peel, lemon juice, and Brett. Quite tart and juicy with a pronounced sourness - lingering acidity into the finish. Phenomenal.

Bottle for breakfast at Cafe Rose Red, 30th October 15. Pours with a large head, pretty carbonated, probably more than I like. Aroma, sour, lemon, funk, fresh. Taste is tart sour, lemon, slight hay. Very refreshing, quite complex. Great as it warmed up, took me an hour and a half to drink this beast. Carbonation high. Very nice
Bottle shared by a friend. Clearish amber pour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, lemon juice, funk and peppery yeast. Malty and lemony flavor with a peppery yeast finish.

Millésime 2013 dégusté en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina. Ce lambic fut servi en accompagnement dun magnifique souper dagneau braisé dans un liquide à base de vin blanc, de romarin dail confit, de romarin et dun fond dagneau précieusement conservé suite à une lente cuisson en papillote. Cétait magnifique. La bière elle-même est très très mousseuse, tant dans le verre que dans lestomac. Vapeurs sèches, très boisées, peu acétiques mais quelque peu sulfureuses titillent mes narines palpitantes. En bouche le liquide me paraît sec bien que boisé à souhait. Peu agressif, court et terminant sa course sur une belle amertume en finale. Un joli substitut au vin blanc pour ce plat!

750ml bottle shared @La Tana (Rome). Pours golden, a bit cloudy, with a medium to little white head. Citrusy aroma, wild yeasts, barnyard, leather, persistent. Flavour is medium sour, persistent, quite complex for a 2 years old gueuze. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice!
Pale, hazy liquid, little head. Fruity but weak aroma. Medium body, little carbonation. Taste is sweet and sour.

Appearance: cloudy, blonde to golden colour, medium carbonation with light white head.
Aroma: funky, slightly sour and sweet, horseblanket. Slightly pithy citrus notes. 
Flavour and Palate: Light bodied, flavours are slightly sweet and initially quite sour, lightly funky. Slight lingering sourness, pleasant final notes of lemon pith and citrus.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass; 2015 vintage, best before 10/31/2034. Bottle #14416. Pours lightly cloudy deep golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big lemon, lime, green apple, cherry, pear, white grape, hay, straw, grass, leather, oak, pepper, cracker, light white wine vinegar, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity/funky/spicy yeast, oak barrel, and light pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, lime, green apple, cherry, pear, white grape, hay, straw, grass, leather, oak, pepper, cracker, light white wine vinegar, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spiciness and light-moderate tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, lime, green apple, pepper, hay, straw, grass, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funk/spicy yeast, oak barrel, and light pale malt flavors; with a great yeast spice/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very dry finish from carbonation. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and fairly acidic/prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an incredible gueuze style. All around awesome complexity and balance of fruity/funky/spicy yeast, oak barrel and light pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. Very classic tasting and well rounded gueuze in complexity and balance. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle @ Jacobs. Vintage 2013. My rating #8000, cheers me, or something... Pours golden with a white head, loads of lively bubbles. Aroma is light sourness, barnyard, dusty, leather, green apples, wet wood, citrus, lemonpeel. Flavor is sourness, barn, dusty notes, leather, sour green apples, citrus. Medium body, lively carbonation, acidic finish. 041015
Bottle, 13 vintage. Hazy dark golden pour with a light fluffy head. Nose has red apples, funk and some barnyard. Taste is light bitter, barnyard, lemon zest and apple skin.

2009 vintage bottle. Light cream golden pour. Aroma is sherbert and tangy sorbet. Taste is sweet lemon citrus with a almost no pucker - almost more like dessert. Good stuff but not crazy sour but certainly delicious.

Bottle, 2015 vintage. Hazy golden with a large fluffy off white head. Looks very inviting. Sour and funky nose. Flavour has wood, barnyard, farts, hay, white pepper, grapes, lemon, musty. Medium body, nice and soft carbonation, some sweetness, medium sour. Well balanced, easy to drink without losing character.
This is a pretty good Gueuze but not worth the price. Its not much different than Cuvee Rene.

2015 bottle. Etre Gourmet. Clear, dark yellow. Lively carbonation keeps alive a thick, bubbly, white head. Damp, papery, lemon pith. Yeasty. Bready. Some underripe berry fruit. Vanilla pod. Orange rind. Grape must. All sorts going on. Very complex. Taste is light tart. Soft, bready sweet. Unexpected, pithy bitterness. Smooth, full palate. Lightly acidic. Finishes dry, tart, and light bitter. Bob on.

2015 bottle. Pours hazy orange w. lasting white head. Really lovely brett character on the nose with early season apples, cut grass, sour hay? citrus and leather. The taste is spot on too. Very full bodied for the style with various soft fruits and leather handbag, leading to a metallic and lemony aftertaste. Great gueuze. Best vintage yet if ya ax me.

Big bottle 
dough, barnyard, basement aromas, cereal, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish,
2015 edition at the Lambikstoempers festival, funky tart nose with a faint hint of cheese, herbal bitterness, a touch of grapefruit. Tart yet with undertones of sweetness.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Millésime 2015. Bouteille numéro 2853. Bel équilibre acidité présente mais modérée. Agréable, belle longueur.
Bottle at gent beer festival, 2015 edition. Pours hazy orange, nose is funky, horseblanket, citrus, taste is dry, funky, sour, fruity.
2015 edition. Light amber, bit cloudy with small white head. Sour fruity aroma. Rich sour fruity taste, some touch of sweet. Slight sour aftertaste. Not bad, but quite topical good geuze.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2015 Botella. @La Tireuse, Biarritz. 06/09/15. Botella: 2013 Nº: 21427 BBD:29/10/2032, Color amarillo, sabor agrio, Buena acidez.

Complex and interesting brew. Expected to be more sour but luckily it was very pleasant balance with sweetness and dryness. Intense fruity and yeasty on nose and less malty for me, almost cider alike. Didnt perceived wood tones. Light to medium body, high carbo. Refreshing indeed and tasty.

Great surprise.. I almost gave up on geuzes before tasted this one. Nice farmhouse bretty, nice not too pushy fruity tartness, quite noticeable wood impact, grapefruit citrusy. Light sweetness with moderate tartness, quite dry in finish. Very nice and refreshing, high drinkability

Bottle shared thanks to Kai! Thanks buddy. Pours dark yellow/orange with a medium white head. Aroma is pretty bretty up front, barnyard, sour green apples, tannic, some sweeter fruits and some wood along with some subtle mushroom-like notes. Pretty weird. Taste is citrussy, leathery, sweet green apples, some sour notes but very mild overall.

Bottle to taster
Horse blanket, sour, yeast, abd pepper. Hazy amber with a frothy white head. Sour, funky lemon.

Pour a beautiful murky dark yellow/light orange, with an everlasting white foamy head. Damn good looking. 
Aroma of brett, sour apples, sligt banana, barnyard, slight citrus, slight leather Really well balanced and well rounded. Definately some complexity, with all sorts of things going on. Everything well integrated. Semi full bodied, with a rather flat carbonation, that suits this greatly. Taste is somewhat sour, definately, but isnt overwhelmingly sour. - well balanced. Thanks hoprider for the treat.

2015 bottle with a cork that shot off instantly. Aroma is moderately oak forward with really nice, earthy, barnyard funk with a light herbal note. Light citrus and tropical fruit notes. The funk to this is really nice. Pours a slightly hazy, pale gold color with a medium sized, fairly frothy, white head that slowly recedes but never disappears. Light lacing and small legs. Flavor is moderately acidic with some light citrus and a touch of acetic acid. Medium light oak notes. Moderately strong, earthy barnyard funk with lighter herbal notes. Some light tropical fruit character and stone fruit skins. Medium light bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, this is a really great geuze, though a bit young. The acidity is still a bit sharp and unbalanced as is the oak, but the funk is really nice and herbal and earthy.

(2015 bottle) the color is orange and a little muddy, with little foam. Sour funky and cheese smell. The taste is funky and sour, yet quite malty and with a very crisp carbonation. The aftertaste is super dry and sourish with a very satisfying mouth feeling.

** Édition 2013 ** Une mousse peu convaincante se forme sur une bière dorée et assez trouble. Très végétal au nez, mais quelques arômes "vineux" picotent les narines également. Lacidité est franche, permettant ainsi de véhiculer à merveille les saveurs fruitées (citrons un peu sucrés, limes) de la bière. Un peu boisé et minéral, cette bière est simplement délicieuse.

Bottle at SinH4?s Goodbye Event. Smooth geuze aroma, very present but not dominating. Pleasant mix of saltiness, sourness, bubbly carbonization, easy to drink and smooth. Very nice! Now give this one two years and see again...

Bottle 2013. Hazy golden pour with white head. Aromas of bandaid, strong brett funk, light peachy sweetness. Funky to the finish, medium-light bodied, light wheat malt balance. Funk and brett through the finish. Good.

Pours a peach golden yellow. Aroma is hay and basement. Taste is high sour and grapefruit along with orange.

At Nialls rockapalooza.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Vintage 2015, consumed July 2015 (Toni calls it "child murder"). Surprisingly dark orange color with big white head. Aroma is wood, horseblanket funk, ripe apples. Taste is lots of wood and apples, quite a nice rather heavy body, some sweetness, apricots, peaches, good finish, not too acidic. Amazing soft foamy mouthfeel despite a very high carbonation (still very young) Easy sipping and a great Gueuze at the same time. Gotta get some of this to age, incredible how awesome this is already now.2009 bottle, shared at Grote Dorst in February 2017. Aroma is basement funk, citric, wood, fresh Bretts, quite bright. Taste is mineraly, citric. Soft carbonation. Excellent.

750, 2011, corked and baled. Pours a crystal clear dark gold with minimal head and no lace. Big tangy nose, showing white wine, soft green apple, sea salt, light lemon, and wet grass and hay. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Lemons, apples, grass, and hay on the mid palate. Mild tart finish. Wondrous.

Bottle courtesy of Ryan at his June 2015 tasting. Pours a golden body with thing fine white lacing. Aroma is like grating aged cheddar against wood. Mouthfeel is minerally with notes of sour apricot, peach, oak and wood. Very nice.
Bottle 15 - pours dark yellow. Nose is lemony, oak, grassy, tart, and acidic. Taste is lemony, tart, acidic, sour, earthy, and slight sweetness. Damn good!!!

2013 vintage bottle no 21054

 a REALLY NICE GEUZE
Bottle @ Delirium Café, Brussels 14/5-15. Vintage 2011, bottle #11273. Fruity and fresh with grapes, also bretty and acidic. Bone dry and acidic finish with grapefruit.

Pours a clear blond beer with a small white head. 
Smells funky, tart, brett, stall.
Tastes sour.
Great blend.

Thanks Kate for sharing! Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy apricot color with a small off white head. Aroma is classic gueuze, tart, yeast, a bit of funk. Flavor has a solid tartness to it with a touch of fleshy fruit sweetness. Overall a very nice beer. Interesting concept.

A bit hazy golden beer with long and lasting head on top. Aroma has zesty green apples and sourness. Some yeast comes up too after awhile. Taste is really sour at first then some sweetness comes up and ending with apples and vanilla flavours. Medium body and high carbonation. Interesting Lambic but Ive tasted better.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Bottle (750 ml) @ Delirium Café, Brussels 150514. [ Vintage 2011 ], bottle #11273. Fruity and bretty, citric, sour, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and citric.

[ Vintage 2015 ] @ Havregatan 20160415. Bottle (750 ml) from Surlådan. Fruity and bretty, dry, horse blanket, light acidic.

750 ml 2011 bottle. Pours a clear copper with a white bead of foam. The aroma is earthy, juicy, mushroomy, and fruity. Subtly sour. Pretty nuanced beer. Medium body and low to medium carbonation. Very good.

Sehr trübe goldgelbe Farbe, ordentliche weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch trocken, pelzig, säuerlich, holzig, Kraut. Geschmack trocken säuerlich, hefig, pelzig, gut!

bottle shared by Cuso at RB Vienna March Tasting. dark yellow, very cloudy color, small white head. smells sour, fruity, pears, apples, some funk, citric, earthy. medium to full body, bubbly, good sourness, citric, astringent, fruits, funky. quite dry / sourish / fruity finish. pretty decent, not as sour as other lambics, which works for me.

Still super drinkable, and very flavourful, just lacks depth.

(2013 bottle sampled at tasting, VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Jan 26 2015) Pours a nearly opaque orange gold with a bubbly, lingering white head. Aroma is nice and woody with a solid Brett funk, musty basement, apple, overripe fruit, slight acidic undertone, wet earth, like the ground under an orchard. Palate is also nice and dry and woody, champagne like, apple flesh and especially skin, very lightly acidic, earthy, pretty complex. Gets even drier towards the finish with very little acid remaining. Apple skin, wood, earth and a little barnyard carries on through the finish and aftertaste. Fairly light body with soft bubbly carb. Definitely on the dry side for a gueuze rather than the acidic side, but this was a surprisingly lovely gueuze. Possesses a really nice balance for drinking, with the "mega" blend still producing a very integrated beer.

Bottle, 2011 - thanks _angst_! Pours clear orange, medium creamy off-white head, dissipates slowly , nice lacing. Aroma is dusty, funky horse blanket, lemon, oak. 750 mL bottle, big thanks to Charles for sharing! Turbid straw colored pour with a bubbly head. Nose and flavor are beautiful, with classic horseblanket funk, tart lemon, hay, musty cobweb, hints of loam. Effervescent, crisp, extraordinarily clean. I dig it.

2013 shared. Hazy gold pour, lovely fluffy white head: looks a treat. Tropical juice nose, loads of mango and pineapple, good sweet funk too, citric zing in there. Sharp citrus end, with lingering tropical funk. Excellent stuff.

text: UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Original 2009 edition for that years Toer de Geuze, with lambic from 3 Fonteinen, Timmermans, Lindemans, Boon, De Oude Cam, Oud Beersel, Hanssens and De Troch, made at Boons and edited under the HORAL label. Limited, with bottled numbers (number one was sold at eBay for a staggering 225 euro). Very thick, rocky, yellowish white head, orange blonde, warm colour, hazy. Very complex aroma, malse lambic with sulphur, more lactic than citric acidity, wet straw, dry sherry, sweat, especially the Boon lambic is noticeable. Soft lactic acidity, some fresh lemon sourness but no astringent vinegar attack, mellow, soft and subtle, extremely complex, estery, lightly sulphuric, with a vague hop bitterness in the end. Needless to say, this is an infinitely complex and well-balanced oude geuze, but still quite accessible. If you can get your hands on a bottle and are into geuze, do not let this opportunity pass by!

Bottle, 2013. Pale yellow, bottle fermented. Lovely barnyardy nose with soft funk, soft hayish malts, some apple seeds. Dry light, but still somewhat soft mouthfeel, long pale malty apple seedy finish. Excellent product, which comes as no surprise. Aroma / Appearance - The carbonated golden base and wispy bubbly head show signs of life. Dry, yeasty, and peppery this is not quite as sharp as the ones from a single brewery. However it still has a nice mix of blue cheese and vinegar that settles in the air.

Flavor / Palate - Vinegar and blue cheese pair together at moderate levels. It is tart, crisp, and acidic but not nearly so much as some other examples. The result is a beer that is much easier to drink yet still retains plenty of flavor. The yeasty peppery finish is a reminder of its inspiration as a collaboration since it matches none of the house profiles of each brewery. This is worth buying if you catch a bottle for under 15 Euro.

Aroma is of barnyard, lemon, grass, funk, mineral and wood. Taste is slightly sweet with classic Gueuze funk and barnyard along with wood, green apple, lemon, grass, mineral notes and hay. Medium body. Dry. Lively carbonation. Very good complex. Really complex and multi-layered. Im really happy to have a couple of bottles left! 4-9-9-4-17 = 4.3

December 29th 2013: Bottle (750 ml). 2013 vintage. Less lemony and less complex than the 2011 bottle. The barnyard is more shy. I think its still need some time to reach is peak. 4-8-8-4-1 6= 4.0

Bottle. Hazy golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of lemons, fruity funk, apples, barnyard and light mineral. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, fruity funk and apples. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice and balanced. Elegant.

2011 vintage, shared by an unnamed fellow. Thanks!

Hazy yellow colour. Yeast, ensilage/hay, citrus and funk to the nose.
Taste is as above but qute subdued.
Dry aftertaste.
Not that sour as the other geuzes Ive had.
Bottle. Amber beer. Citrus and barnyard aroma. Grapefruit, citrus, rubber, sourish flavour with some woody notes.

bottle thanx to / shared with kurt ( belgiuminabox.com ) thanx dude ! 

pours blonde, good white foam. 3 fonteinen-like funk ( could also be de cam , as they are much alike to me ) in the scent. yet not overpowering, so it still has some complexity. 
to carbonated for sure. most carbonated geuze so far, id say .. 
apples, sour, and very dry. lambics? well i now understand how they say this is  too much ; you cant find anything realy recognizable. between 9 ( ! ) lambics. its a very intresting one, for sure, but still prefer a basic de cam / cantillon / 3 f over this . the many diffrent flavours kinda knock out  eachother...

750ml bottle, 2013 vintage.  Pours a slightly hazy gold with no head.  Aroma is sweet to start, then sour with horse shit and barnyards.  Taste has a subtle sour lemon start and a sharp sour cheesy finish.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2015 Bottle at Endos house, 25/05/13, from Dranken Geers Gent - 2011 vintage.
Hazed light golden with a thin off white head of bubbles that clear to the edge.
Nose is burnt grass, lemon rind, funk, damp wood, the top draw in grandads shed, must.
Taste comprises lemon rind, light smoke, woody notes, grass, light spice, tarte grape skins, good ball of funk, soured apple pips.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp and refreshing in the execution, puckering in the climax.
Great stuff! 2011 - 10/4/8/4/17.
2013 Vintage, 13/12/14. 9/5/9/5/18.
shit keeps giving !!! @ 4. 9

text:
Poured into a tulip. 2011 vintage.

3.5 A: Well hazed dark yellow with some brownish hues. Three finges of frothy white head. Retention is about average and a few whisps of lacing are left.

4.25 S: Smells like a saison in a lot of ways. Funk forward without a lot of acidity. Flowery and herbal to start with a dry woodiness underneath. Dust, dryrot, jasmine, pollen, wildflower, and apple orchard. Super dry with lots of depth and complexity though not a geuezy as others Ive had.

4.25 T: Ahhh, here it is. While anyone could mistake the nose for that of a saison, the taste is decidedly gueuze. Lots of funk in the nose as well, but a sollid acidity as well. Flowery and herbal again with the same dry woodiness, pollen, wildflowers, and apple orchard. Mild, but balancing tartness and a bit more tangy lactic acid. Fruitiness that wasnt really found in the nose is now here. Plenty of lemon, a bit of lime, apple, and peach. Solid here with good complexity and depth.

3.75 M: Lighter medium body. Good upper moderate carbonation. Not particularly creamy or spritzy, but good nonetheless.

4.0 D: Solid all around. A bit pricey, but such is the style. Definitely worth a try and a not a bad beer to stock up on either.

Serving type: bottle

04-05-2013 02:25:05
ive had all vintages yet released! and the best one so far IMO is the 2009. tasty but becomes a bit too much...

Bottled sample from the 2009 vintage, shared with oakbluff. Gold in colour with spritzy and strong carbonation. Aromas are of lemon curd, funk and herbs (especially fresh thyme and white pepper). Flavors are of lemon peel, dry wood, a bit of fresh cheese and minerals. Sour and dry on the palate. Not as harmonious as some of the individual contributors are on their own, but still quite tasty.

Great overall blend of geuze. Nose of green unripe fruits, fine lactic notes in the taste. Not to overwhelminig acidity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2013 Yeah, I really like this gueuze. Highly citric; lemon citrus all day! Funky cheese, lemon lime, straw, horse blankets, funky yeast (more funky than earthy), and has citrus to spare. 

Update: Had the 09 again last night and want to bump this up a tad, as its consistently been fantastic every time Ive tried it.  11 is drinking very nicely right now too, yet the 09 is clearly superior.  Im glad this still flies under the radar as its one of my very favorite gueuze.

Bottle (2009 vintage) @ a recent tasting...  Poured golden with a thick forming white head.  Nice retention.  This was a great tasting gueze that I would love to revisit.  Bright citrus with acidic tartness and some funky yeast musk.  Not as intense as the Armand Zomar 4 we had at the same tasting, but this one held its own.  Sour and dry in the finish.

750mL bottle at Kulminator, pours a cloudy golden orange with a very large off-white head and quite a bit of sediment. Nose is quite dusty and yeasty, with dusty soured light dried fruits and loads of sediment. Flavour is quite a bit more inviting -- very funky, full of dusty barnyard funk notes, a little sour apricot, cardboard and yeast. One of the dustier gueuzes Ive had, though not in an "off-note" type of way. Quite complex with many layers, though Im not sure this quite enters the league of the best gueuzes out there. Certainly excellent though.

Huge white head floating atop a clear golden elixir. Some of lacing. Nice woody, earthy aroma. Slight citrusy nose mixed with a funkiness. A sweet twang. The aromas are in the taste as well. But more of a mango taste. Finish is slightly tart. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ De Heeren van Liedekercke. 2009, 2011 and 2013 samples.
Totally agree with yiannos below, we had the samples together, so I quote him "Acidic citrusy, barnyard aromas. 2009 version had little aroma, but was more acidic. 2011 was the best of the 3"

Bottle 75 cl, 2011 vintage, BBE 2030. Pours golden in color with a small white head. Light vinegar, some stable notes and a bit of garden fruits in aroma. Slight chewy mouthfeel at first which turns into more of a sparkling mouthfeel. Sour in taste, some tart applefruity notes and a bit of wheaty notes as well in taste. Seems to be quite well balanced and its just a pleasure to enjoy this gueuze. A bit of fruity lemon notes appears in aftertaste. Really pleasant taste with some sour notes, a bit of fruity sweetness and fresh apple tartness.
@ De Heeren van Liedekercke. 2009, 2011 and 2013 samples. Acidic citrusy, barnyard aromas. 2009 version had little aroma, but was more acidic. 2011 was the best of the 3.
Bottle. Not well cared. Pours a clear yellow with no head. Taste is very dry and yogurt like. Disappointing.

text:
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 HORAL blend 2013. 75cl bottle shared by 3 @Grote Dorst, Toer de Geuze 2013. - none too acidic, mildly zest-bitter (older peels) and rather earthy, apple cider-like geuze, smooth and enjoyable for a blend this democratic, that would only benefit and gain complexity from some aging. 7% abv very well tucked away and serving a full and rich taste to complement its rich and earthy environment. To paraphrase Wallace Stevens: it is almost possible "to taste the nothing that has not been turned into this cultured brew". // // 2015 Edition sampled at Tilquin English Beer festival and during Toer de Geuze 2015 + bottle No. 01476 shared at home: very easygoing lemonade and green apple cider Oude Geuze with a younish brett profile midway between Oud Beersel and the sweeter malts of Boon. Drying, quenching, with a tad watery core maybe. Missing a bit ot grapefruit/citrus zest from the old hops, but theres ample lime pith and late gentle earthy funk. Good entry level geuze, this Anniversary Mega Blend 2015. //////

Note: please someone split up these very different versions? (2009-11-13-15)

Bottle at Toer de Geuze 2013.
Dorée sur un léger voile paille, col blanc fin.
Arôme st ici typique de cet assemblage de différents lambics avec ce nez de gueuze très agréable. Grains, léger fruité avec une pointe aigre-acidulé.
Palais est ici aussi complexe, sec avec une petite rondeur de douce en fin bouche. Note semi-tropicale, fruité agrumes, avec pas mal de citronné acidulé. Effervescence est légère pour un fin sec et poussiéreux.

2013 Horal blend, 37.5cl glass poured from a 75cl bottle at Boon Brewery during the Tour of Gueze.  Early days to be drinking this one. the recommendation on the bottle is to keep this until 2015 at the earliest.

Pore

Poured cloudy Into the glass with a big frothy head. A light fresh gueze.. Perhaps explained by its youth. Lacking the depth of the previous blends at this point. One to come to in a few years.
33 cl bottle at brouwery Boon. Clear light orange body. strong carbonation. Nice sour geuze. **

750 ml bottle shared at RBSG 10.  Pours a hazy golden hint of orange color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma is funky, gueuze, tart lemon, bread with honey, barnyard.  The flavor has tart, spritzy lemony citrus, funk, bready notes.  This is not too over the top; quite drinkable and pretty smooth.

Bottle compliments of Eric, huge thanks for this sour treat. Pours a hazy orange with medium head. Aromas and taste of super sour peach, very light oxidation, copper, oak, leather, barn, and funk. So salivating and horsed out yo.

2011 Bottle at the Grote Dorst.  The pour is pale yellow with a small white head.  The nose is lemony, vinegar, light spice and some barnyard earthiness.  The taste is sweet with a nice bitter/tart balance.  The mouthfeel is very much alive, big effervesence.  Light boyd and a long finish.  My opinion is that this bottle could do with some time.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Blind tasting off 18 current available Gueuzes. Shared with Mathieu87.
2011 edition 75cl.
Appearance: gusher, nice head.
Nose: not so much in the nose, some fruit.
Taste: kiwi, citrus, Brett.
9/3/8/3/13
UPDATE
Comparis of 2011 edition and 2013 edition.
2013: lighter blond beer, a lot more carbonation. more fresh and more fruits.
2011: darker blond beer, more flat. Aged very well! 
Re-rate to 9/3/9/3/16
Glorious nose of soft sour aromas. Perfectly tart mouth with excellent texture. Very tasty.

2011 vintage. Pours a misty golden body with fizzy white head. Fruity aroma, vinegar like sourness, light malts and hay. Rounded of sour start, foamy mouthfeel. Ending is a bit sharper, but still accessible. Salty finish. Good lambic, not overly complex though. (75cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

Bouteille verte de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de pamplemousse et de pomme verte. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse et de pomme verte avec une pointe de raisin vert. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Forte effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement acide. (Rating #4607)

18.01.13. Bottle. Lots and lots of foam kept pouring out of the bottle. In the glass it is quite porous and settles quickly. Clear copper-colored beer. Aroma slight caramel, sour apple. Tastes sour and dry. Medium carbonation, a bit stingy. Long sour aftertaste. Overall a decent beer, lots of flavor.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 First ratingAt the ekstedt vintage tasting on December 28, 2012. This was a pause beer, not a vintage vertical, 75 cl bottle thanks ekstedt! BB 28.10.2030. Nr. 014496.cloudy orange color, white head. Acidic, apple, vinegar scent. Tart, acidic, sour taste. Spritzy mouthfeel, very low bitterness. Very nice!8/3/8/3/15=3.7Rerate75 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet, sampled on September 23, 2014 in Ludvika.2011 vintage.Cloudy orange color, small yellow head. Acidic, bettles, berries, sour smågodis scent. Rubber, red currant peels, acidic aftertaste. Acidic, tart aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, very low bitterness.8/3/8/3/16=3.8
Bottle (75 cl) from bieresgourmet.be. Clear amber, medium white head. Mild woody grapefruit aroma with some horsestable, and tangerines. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Dry with medium acidity.

2011 version, 13C. Gold with a white head that lasts well. High bead. Aroma of the basement, old lemons, lime leaf, apricot stones/ almonds, sweat. Less aggressively funky and tart than it smells. Slightly slippery, pretty high carbonation - a swirl or two was good. Taste has some apricot/ peach sweetness, flowers, grapefruit, apricot stones. Even a little peppery at the end. Sourness is brooding rather than edgy. Not achingly dry at the end, but thats OK. Plenty of intrigue, some wildness - yet easy drinking. Excellent.
Bottle, thanks Craig. Hazy golden yellow with white head. Sharp funky aroma, lemon, citrus. Taste is nice sharp and funky. Tiny bit of sweetness and lightlyttart. Very nice

Bottle, 2009 vintage, 11/19/2012. Pours light caramel chestnut, foamy rocky head, fades eventually leaving sudsy lacing, champagne bubbles around side of glass. Aroma of grapefruit pulp with citrus, tart green apples and pear, leathery barnyard funk to balance with musty oak character. Taste is bright, tart green apple and white grape, vinous, with nice acidity, moderate funk, vanilla, with sour fruity finish. Light, lively, refreshing body, champagne-like carbonation. Nice, fruity geuze but still balanced.

2009 bottle, thanks to Ludvig and fredrik_!
Dark golden with champagne-like rising bubbles in the glass, huge white head.
Aroma: green apples and citrus fruits.
Taste: super tart, green apples, sour grapefruit and lemons, dry.
Medium bodied with lively carbonation.
Pretty nice.

Pours a hazy and amber beer with a white head. The aroma is fruit, tart and sourness. The flavor follows the nose with additional grapefruit. The palate is sweetness, acidity and bitterness. Overall a really good and complex beer.

Bottle. Clear golden with a fizzy white head.  Strong earthy, vegetal, brassy, alcohol, and sharp sour fruit aroma and taste with notes of lemon, cherry, and a dry oak finish.  Nice thick creamy palate.

Bottle from etre gourmet.

Some good stuff in this bottle. Really liking this. Had both the 2009 and the 2011. I thought the 2009 was better.

750ml bottle thanks to grownfool. More orange than yellow with a good foamy head. Smell was slightly sour, dusty citrus, good. The taste was also very good but did not have a lot of horseblanket or barnyard, mostly sour citrus with a slight bit of phenol and rubber on the backend. This was so damn easy to drink, quite good. I had read that this gueuze was not so great but I disagree, this was a very good gueuze.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-07-2011 02:01:24

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is big funky fruity barney bretty green apple musky spicy madness. Flavour is red fruits, green apple, some spice, medium funky sourness. Not sure if complex or chaotic, but defenitely nice.

Bottle @ home. Hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of funky earth, blue cheese, horse blanket and more brett. Flavor is spicy and slightly sour. Well balanced and with a thick body. Nice brew, but a bit overkill. Unblended has more character.

Pours yellowy orange with a white head. Aroma has sour berries, lots of well balancing brett, grapefruit, stable, wood, citrusy and overall tart. Taste has grapefruit, a bit of sulfur, tartness, wood, citrus fruits, plants and bacteria. Refreshing and kick ass!

Bottle @ THE Sour Tasting. 2011 Vintage. The pours golden amber with a medium eggy white head. The nose is dusty lemon peel, some barnyard, soft wood and sea salt. The taste is wonderfully bucolic, notes of citrus mingled with earthy barnyard flavors. Hints of light angel food cake, pillowy mouthfeel. Zippy, light body. Pretty excellent stuff.

Bottle thanks Rasmusott! Aroma: loads of sulfur, gunpowder,  wood, funky! Musty, lacto acid,  wet wood, stable, lemon, vinegar,  sour grape, saw dust, dandelion, sweet lemon,  fizzy, high carbonation, very acidic, funk loads of lemon, wood, sulfur, saw dust, quite dry, sparkling, taste follows the nose. Really lovely!
Bottled. Pours golden with a huge white head. Smells sour, fruity and white pepper. Tastes sour, creamy and bitter.

2009 version. 75 cl bottle, thanks to Dazz3, at the pretasting for USA comes to Skövde. Somewhat hazy golden beer with a small offwhite head. Sour fruity aroma, rubber, leather, grapefruit, citrus, sourish, grapes, floral notes, hay, citrus, barnyard, some lemongrass, woody. Leather and barnyard flavor, citrus, grapefruit, citrus, grapefruit, rubber, floral notes, herbal, floral. Surprisingly balanced, still rather sour, leather finish, grapefruit, citrus, woody, some pine.

Bottle: 2011: No. 014403:
Small to medium and quick disappearing white head on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Smell lot of yeast, wood and cellar, some sharper yellow and orange fruit, garbage, wet cellar.
Taste yeast, wood, older yellow fruit, light sour, old hops, wood, light bitter, old hay, cellar yeast.
Tasty, like a blend of good old geuze (the tarty yeastness) and the sweeter less tart geuzes.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and a light creamy light watery texture.
Very nice blend!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 2011 edition, bottle number 05292. It pours hazy golden yellow, with a thin fizzy white head. The nose is barnyard, sour apricot, tangerine, orange, sour yoghurt and Savlon. The taste is pleasantly tart, lemon, white grape skin, green apple, sour apricot, lightly acidic, hay, floral aspect, touch of bitterness, wood, barnyard and a hint of underlying sweetness holds it all together. Long, tart finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Not the sourest of geuzes, but for me the balance is perfect. Complex, yet highly drinkable. Bravo HORAL!

Bottle: Golden, hazy, small and stable white frothy head, malic acid, citric acid and traces of peppermint(?) in the nose,  light wheaty-grainy touch, a bit cellary, too; moderate sour flavour, accompanied by a light bitterness, medium bodied, a bit fizzy(!); lingering and a bit warming citrussy-cellary finish. Yes, well balanced and moreish Gueuze

golden body, white head, redish hue. Aroma of light fruity tartness at first, some acidicity, cereals, raw wheat, strangely mild and balanced. Some toffee in aroma after yeast is poured in. Flavour has hint of tobacco at 1st taste, sligtly acidic fruits, mellow sourness. Some lactic acids after yeast pouring.
Pours cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma is acidic, leather, grapefruit and a sweet note. Flavour is acidic, fruit, sweet, leather and grapefruit. Dry aftertaste.

Shared by Chris at Ebs 8/23/2012
Pours into the glass a murky amber color a smallish off white head that quickly dissipates. Smells of sour and tart fruits, a bit of caramel and vinegar with a solid does of must and funk. The flavor is a hint of caramel sweetness up front that is quickly devoured by tart cherries and lemons. Lots of acid and a hint of vinegar with a mild amount of funky flavor. Crispy bubbly mouthfeel with a light to medium body and a solid shot of carbonation. Very nice geuze, quite complex, I wish I had a bottle or two to hold onto for a while.
Excited for this one & it didnt disappoint! Vinegar, light fruit, sour, citrus. Dry finish. Great example of the style, but not surprising considering the breweries involved!

Bottle   # 3057 from Etre Gourmet webshop. Pours hazy light golden with a big white head. Aroma is light tarty, cellar, and some almonds nuttyness. Taste is dry and very crisp with a nice woody bite, high carbonated, fresh green apples. Very good and refreshing.

Shared 750 ml green "champagne" bottle at local tasting. Bottle No. 03057. ABV is 7%. Hazy golden colour, moderate white head. Intense typical gueuze aroma, sourish character, farmhouse notes. Sour brettanomyces flavour, some lemony notes, tart finish.

Shared 75 ml bottle kindly shared by my beer pal Ole Anders. Bottle no. 03057. Misty golden with a white film. Grape fruit peel, berries, wooden notes and a little light malts on the nose. Acidic, fresh, bitter some citrus flavors. Medium body. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2013 Bottle at Home shared with friends, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks Man! Poured a hazy peach color with a small white head and no lacing. Peach, tannin, super funky, dust, lemon peel, basement, sweaty socks, woody, and citrus. Taste is tart apricot, lactic acid, tart lemon, wax, woody, so funky, urine, bright honey, vanilla, and cheese with a big sour finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Nicely tart, funky, yet well-balanced and easy to drink. Cheers!

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, 2011 bottle thanks Aaron! Hazy orange pour with white head, aroma has parmesan cheese, mix of funk, dusty basement, hints of earthy grass, some slight orange and lemon notes as well.  Taste is sweet orange and tart lemon, some nice cheesy notes with a hint of lactic and slight burning notes, touch of lemongrass, finishing fairly sweet but with nice lactic lemon notes.

Bottle @ Stephens house, picked up in Bruges. Hazy, golden orange appearance with a white head. Fairly sour, rich lemon, somewhat cheesy, dusty, basement aromas. Fairly sour, somewhat acidic, mild vanilla, somewhat oaky, lemon citrusy, funky flavor. Pretty nice beer though I prefer some of the blended beers in this better.

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

Served in my Cantillon tulip.

A: This beer appears very hazy and orange in color. As this was shared at a tasting and not continuously poured, I am quite certain that I received some sediment in my serving, creating the cloudier than normal appearance. The head hangs out for a while before leaving a few touches of lacing upon the glass.

S: The aroma is just terrific. I so enjoy the smell of an authentic Belgian gueuze. I could enjoy this aroma for hours. Funky and awesome, with hints of musty citrus and wild grasses.

T: The taste was also terrific. Nice and funky, and very easy to drink. The flavor lingers long after each sip.

M: Funky, puckering and wonderful. Great feel.

D: A fine example of a gueuze. I look forward to acquiring some of this delicious beer for the cellar.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-25-2011

750 ml bottle. Toer de Geuze 2011. N° 03065. From bierkompass.de.
Cloudy slightly reddish golden colour with small to average size white head.
Berries, sourness, tart, earth, leather and mild toffee sweetness in aroma.
Flavour is nice blend of sour and tart Lambic berriness and some smoothing sweetness. Redcurrant and hogweed. Very drinkable and balanced Lambic. 
Matti, theres 2009 version waiting for you.
2011. Provada al Drunk Monk amb molt bona companyia. Joia per a disfrutar amb el millors amics!

750mL at the RBSG Grand Tasting. Full haze straw. Spotty lacing. Nose is huge grapefruit, citrus pith, leather. Excellent blend of Girardin and Drie Fonteinen. Thankfully standing out the most here. Taste is spicy, caramel, leather, grapefruit, white pepper. Big lactic, leathery, rindy palate. Very yummy. Grapefruit forward. A real treat.

09 Bottle. Beautiful clear amber pour with a mountainous white head. Ripe fruity funk with lemon peel and funky farm pasture give way to striking vinous acidity and woody basement. Medium body for the style with ample caressing carbonation and a bone dry finish. Excellent blend!

Bottle shared at the May 2012 iteration of the Santa Cruz tasting series. Golden color with a white froth. Lemons and stone fruit, citric earthy without too much sourness. Smooth and drinkable -- definitely not an enamel-melter -- mild by gueuze standards but still very well put together. Oaky bretty finish, hefty body.

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow with a small head. Aroma is fruity - oranges, green apples, and a touch of banana, also musty yeast notes, brettanomyces, blue cheese, sharp lacto impressions, good aroma. The taste finds a really good balance between tartness and more sweet, fruity notes. Decently tart and yeast focused with bites of tart apples, grape fruit, and in the sweeter side it has cantaloupe and a hint of malty sweetness. Well attenuated and pleasantly dry on the palate. Well made on all sides.

Bottle No 05948 at ØlKonsortiet. Pours slightly hacy yellow. Aroma is fresh, sour barnyard. Taste is not as sour as expected, very grapefruit taste. Very nice balance!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011. #25222. Mi-orge mi-houblon. Hazy orangey blonde. Fluffy off-white head dissipates to a bubbly film. Nose tart, orangey, not too overpowering in any direction, little bit tart of course. Lots of earthy spice, root spices. Some apple. Mouth tart and dry, appley, tannin, drie fonteinen influence is strong, touch of cantillon. Tannin lasts with a touch of sweetness, and the gueueze attack at the throat. Good, but not mindblowing as I expected.

2011 Batch.
Pour is pale yellow, lively carbonation and white bubbly head.The nose is very funky, tons of cob web with a nice rind like aroma.  Hints of sweet lemon but very light.  The flavor adds more balance and much more sweetness.  The webby funk is decent, more sweetness with a light peppery spice.  Peaches and a touch of lemon with a fairly sour spike to it.  The mody is creamy and syrupy, decent carbonation and fairly dry. Very nice stuff.

Thanks Shawn for sharing. Poured into a tulip glass at 45 Degrees F. 2011 Vintage. Enjoyed with friends.

A - Half-Finger white head. Hazey, dark gold appearance.

S - Wow. Bread, spices, earthiness, funk and very much a Geuze in all ways

T - Intense tart and sour. Sweeter than expected. Grapefruit, sweet yeast and honey traces.

M - 80% mouthfeel carbonation, dry and zero lingering of the tartness. It leaves pretty fast

O - Very interesting. Great but not an A+

75 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Rated on 20100726.
Pours golden color with small head. Aroma of sour fruits and grapes, lemon, mild grass notes and yeast. Flavor of fruits, grapes, goose berries, yeast and mild apricot.
2011 bottle.  Aroma of tart lemony apricots,  green grapes,   old cellar.   Big juicy body,  dry.  Nice.   Drie font and boon mariage parfait mix most come to mind.  Nice.

Toer de Geuze 2011, bottle.

Treating myself after work with a bit of homework. Just arrived in the shop alongside some other amazing Lambics, so thought Id give this a whirl. As soon as I saw it was a mega blend, I HAD to try it.
Pours loose with a tight bubbly head. This is quite interesting, as it acts as though its a sparkling wine. It has that white wine aroma, taste, and sparkle, and as with previous experiences of lambics, I find I keep reminding myself that this is a beer. That is one thing I do love about Lambics.
The sparkle gives constant streams of bubbles coming from several points at the base of the glass (drinking from a Westmalle chalice), and keeps the tight head constant.
A pleasant beer with a lovely aftertaste which shoots in and out quite quickly to create a dry finish.
Nose appears to have a nice sweet element.
Admittedly not the best Geuze Ive had this week, but a treat none the less!
Fairly dessert wine-esque.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark gold with thin, fizzy white head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is white wine, lemon, grassy notes, straw malt, yeast, and other sour fruit. Flavor is heavy sour fruit esters and white wine flavors with light malt undertones; dry, sour finish. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

2011 vintage.  Pours hazy orange with a large, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing.  Aroma is black walnut, dust, spicy and earthy hops, straw and hay malt with grapes and oak.  Flavor is acidic and tart grapes, oak, light hops and bitterness, malt, earthy and a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation, light warmth.

2011 version, 750ml. Clear-to-hazed orange-gold with a high, subsiding foam that sits atop the beer until the tumbler is drained. Dank hay, mouldering lime, mellow horse, sap, sherbet, even a trace of wine gummy, orange rind-accented hop in the aroma. Tingling, persistent carbonation; even fizz; stomach-gurgling, sherbet acidity mellowed into drinkability. Lime juice/zest, Brie rind, cream cheese, crab apple, Love Heart. Sharp but not enamel stripping. A great sessions blend bringing together the creaminess of 3F with Cantillons more hardcore aspects; not only did I finish a whole glass but a bottle before realising its 7%, not 5%. Are we going dancing now?

Big thanks to storminorman for this one. It pours hazy pale matte gold with off white head. The big old aroma forces up notes of body odor, some vinegar, tart citrus and thin oaky spiciness. The taste is tart and somewhat acidic to start and then picks up notes of spicy oak and chewy grapefruit. It ends fresh, crisp and tart and has enough non acidic tart notes to tie this thing together. I dig it.

2011 bottle.

A - almost clear golden orange with a finger of head. 

S - small amount of cobweb funk and hay intermingled with lemon.

T - Not much acidity in the taste, the funky yeast and fresh grass is nice though. 

M - Medium body and carbonation, slightly dry finish.

O - Definitely not as sour as the 2009, but has more balance and will be a better candidate for aging. It seems like Armand played a big part in this blend because it was very similar to the 2010 DF geuze we opened next to it.

2011 bottle, thanks Matt! Pours a blonde colour with a thick white head. A fantastic aroma of horse blanket and lemon. Bone dry with flavours of lemon, chalk, digestive biscuits and barley. Moderate carbonation. Stunning.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2012 750 ml bottle bought @ Bierzwerg.de. Shared at epic tasting on February 11.  Pours hazy golden with a huge white head that quickly dissipates while leaving some lacing. Smell is sour with lemon juice, green apples, leather, hay and horse blanket. Taste is sour and similar to the smell with lemon juice, orange zest, apples, hay, horse blanket and funk. Mouthfeel is tart and medium-bodied. Finish is dry and tart with grass, apples and hay.Re-rate! Bottle courtesy of dazz3. 2009 vintage compared to the 2011 vintage Ive tried before. Very good stuff. Raising the rating a little.

(bottle) pours a hazy golden colour with a huge frothy white head. aroma of citrus fruits, slightly perfumed, with a hint of young cheese, rose pettles and potato starch. flavour is mostly lemons, with a hint of yeast and vanilla, again some perfume and a tart doughy finish. medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation.

Thanks to Kramer for bringing this one to our recent gueuze tasting. 2009 bottle.

A - Pours hazy golden orange with a nice one finger tall white head leaving spotty lace down the glass.

S - Smells of lots of barnyard funk initially, plenty of lemon zest, wet hay and a bit of vinegar at the end. The balance of funk to fruit is very nice.

T - Starts off with a tart acidic kick quickly giving way to hints of bright lemon zest, barnyard funk and some light spice. Some dry oak tannins creep in after my first few sips. Finish is fairly dry, lingering on the pallet for some time.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Tart, dry feel lingering through the finish. Not as sour as some of the others, more balanced really.

O - I really enjoyed this one. It had a ton of complex flavors and the desired dry finish. All in all a very enjoyable gueuze. Thanks for sharing this one Kramer.

Courtesy of _angst_. Pours hazy orange amber with a small bubbly off white head leaving some lace. Aroma is dry, fruity, sour, tart. Flavor is sour, dry, fruity, cellar, stable. Finishes sour tart fruity.

Where the Wild Beers Are, 2011. Better than the average Boon geuze. Clear and yellow.  Sour aroma with yeast, and sour flavor, but less so than most other lambics. They still pulled off the flavors and aroma well.  Good.

75cl bottle shared with Thompson. Hazy yellow color, decent sized fizzy white head that becomes small pretty quickly. Smell sour and lightly burned rubber. Taste moderately sour, some unripe fruits. Medium carbo, low to medium body.
light sour,golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, fizzy, nice harmonic finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and moderate sour - barn. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Flavor is rather dry and moderate acidic. Sharp. 270112

75cl bottle. 2011 vintage. Pours a clear golden color with a nice white head.  Aroma is nice and complex: lemony, strong funkyness with fruitiness and some spiciness. Nice acidic notes with some slight wood. Taste is rich and complex. Strong funkyness again and tartness sorrounded by a sort of yogurt-like sweetness. Huge citrus and lemon peel notes. Grassy notes in the background. Some wood and fruit too. Mostly dry finish. Palate is silky, with good carbonation. This gueuze is the most similar to the supreme Lente in the citrussy/funky profile. Only it appears slighly more acidic than 3Fs. Awsomeness.
No aroma. Clear amber, medium head, good lacing. Orange and lime flavor.Above average sourness. Fruity with little wild yeast character.

Medium yellow coloured and hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Heavy yeasty aroma, barnyard, faint sugars too. Flavor starts light sweet and finish moderate acidic and bitter. Dry, creamy texture. Soft carbonation.
Aroma is tart. Huge, frothy, white head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, light yellow body. Light bitter and sour flavor. Light to medium palate.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with large creamy white mostly diminishing head. Aroma is Citrus. Sour flavor.

Bottle. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderat malty and hopy and heavy sour aroma. Moderate bitter very sour flavor. Average moderate sour flavor. Nice balance. Creamy palate. Nice but lacks power to be absolutely great.
Cloudy golden / copper colour with a beige head. Typical farmyard lambic aroma. Flavour didnt really hit the high notes for me, just not my thing I suppose, bit sweet for my liking perhaps.
Unclear and golden beer. Very sour sour, citrus, acidic notes and earthly notes. Very likeable.

My Bottom Line :  
Dusty basement notes are enlivened by citrus fruit and wheat biscuits before an acetic punch seals this dry Gueuze. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A slice of foam tops the cloudy dark yellow.
-The flavor profile was more intense than the aroma, as well as more revealing.
-White grapes are part of the fruity character tasted.
-The frothy effervescence, made of tiny bubbles, increases drinkability for such an intense brew.
-Sourness is prominent, and refreshment is guaranteed, if you can tolerate this level of intensity in acidity, that is.

Bottle.
Fra flaske i Hanssens Artisanaal under Tour de Geuze 2011. Ser ut som eplejuice. Uklar. Lavt skum. Syrlig fruktaroma. Samme med smaken. Sprudlende. Lett, litt syrlig ettersmak.

750mL poured into the Tilquin tumbler. Pours a light copper/goldenrod with a finger of bone dry head. Aromas of sharp brett, hay, body odor, and lemon. This geuze is still pretty new...notes of sharp, complex funk, cheese, lemon peel, white grapes. I think a few years will round this geuze out nicely.
Pours a hazy golden amber color. Aromas of wood, grass, yeast, some fruit and spice. Taste is yeasty, sour and medicinal, can really taste the funk in this one. Outstanding!!!
Bottle 2011. Color dark orange with medium head. Aroma grape, sour, apple, earth. Taste sour, acid, grape, citrus.

750 ml. 2011 bottle, bb 28 10 2030. Opaque orange amber with a large pillow of spongy foam. Aroma is both fresh and musty: grape must, white wine, sharp cheese, earthy spice, resin, beeswax. Taste is white wine, sour grape, cranberry, light cheese, and some earthy resin. Medium body is watery, tart and dry with acidity, and has medium-high carbonation. Pretty much like a nice white wine and aged cheese blended into a martini glass with a dash of peppery vinegar.

75 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, rated on 07.08.2010
